text: No Deal a deal or no brexit no in the
referendum we voted to leave and
Parliament said it would honor that
decision so it's made a log which means
we leave we can't just say we fancy
staying now it's not that simple well in
March 2017 Theresa May activated
something called article 50 now that
started a two-year time frame in which
we had to sort out the terms of our
departure from the EU so organise things
like what would happen to you sit ins
living in the UK and British citizens
living abroad how much money if any we
should pay the EU now that time frame
runs out soon on March the 29th as
things stand we leave then whether we've
sorted those things out or not but some
people do want to press pause on the
process but others think that would be a
terrible idea and we should just get on
with it if the UK did want to extend
that article 50 phase it would have to
ask the EU and all of the EU other 27
countries would have to agree to in
effect delay brexit we might have heard
of something called a transition period
now that would mean that once we
officially leave at the end of March
there's a period after where not much
changes so there's time to put things in
place like new trade or immigration laws
but that transition period is part of a
deal so if there is no deal there is no
transition we just leave
[Music]
well back in November the EU and the UK
government did agree a deal caught a
withdrawal agreement and it sorted out
things like citizens rights how much
money would pay the EU and what would
happen at the border between Islands
which will be in the EU and Northern
Ireland which will be part of the UK the
trouble is lots of MPs don't like it and
MPs have to sign it off all the time
they don't well it makes it more likely
that we will leave without a deal oh and
so far the EU says that deal is the only
deal they're not going to renegotiate it
well no one really knows but when it
comes to trade it means the UK would
trade with the EU as a third country
because we'd no longer be a member so
we'd use rules already drawn up by the
World Trade Organization that's a global
body which governs international trade
so UK exports we would put under the
same checks and tariffs that the EU puts
on other countries which aren't members
and the EU has said that would mean
there would be a hard border so checks
on goods going between northern islands
and Island
[Music]
the Prime Minister has often said that
and there are people particularly brexit
ears who agree with her they say it
would mean the UK could be fully
independent do trade deals around the
world and we shouldn't make compromises
that would stop us getting a clean break
from the EU but those who are against No
Deal say if that were to happen it could
cause chaos at the borders push up food
prices and could damage businesses and
the economy there are some in Parliament
who are trying to stop No Deal
others want the Prime Minister to rule
it out to resume says the best way to
avoid No Deal is to back her deal
